intro: Tristaniopsis kinabaluensis subsp. silamensis, commonly known as the Bornean tristaniopsis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the high-altitude regions of Borneo, specifically found in the mountainous areas of Sabah and Sarawak. This subspecies is characterized by its slender, erect stem and opposite, ovate leaves with a leathery texture. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are typically surrounded by a cupular structure. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the cool, moist conditions of its montane habitat.
